text: Antonine Plague (English: Antonine Plague), also named the Galen Plague (after the Roman doctor Claudius Galen), was a time from 165 to 180 AD when many people became very sick. Historians think they had smallpox. People who caught the Antonine Plague had fevers, chills, diarrhea and pock marks that left scars. ==References== Category:Diseases caused by viruses Category:160s Category:170s Category:Roman Empire
title: Antonine Plague
